question.title: Unable to Retrieve Environment Variable with @Value
question.body:
Given the following code in a Junit class:

@Component
public class TestValueTest {
  @Value("${TEST_VALUE}")
  private String testValue;
  @Value("${env.TEST_VALUE}")
  private String testValue2;
  @Value("${environment.TEST_VALUE}")
  private String testValue3;

  @BeforeEach
  public void setup() {
    System.out.println("[debug] TEST_VALUE: " + testValue);
    System.out.println("[debug] env.TEST_VALUE: " + testValue2);
    System.out.println("[debug] environment.TEST_VALUE: " + testValue3);
  }

  @Test
  public void test() {
    assertEquals(1, 1);
  }
}

When I try to test this code, these variables remain set to null.

Terminal Output:

> echo ${TEST_VALUE}
HelloWorld
> mvn clean install
//Irrelevant additional maven output
[debug] TEST_VALUE: null
[debug] env.TEST_VALUE: null
[debug] environment.TEST_VALUE: null
//Irrelevant additional maven output

What do I need to do to get my environment variable to properly populate in my test class?

The sample terminal output is being run in a MacOS environment, if that matters.
